resource_dependency.emailComposeFormSchema: Database table 'emails' with fields: id (UUID), subject (string), body (text), sender_email (string), recipients (array of strings), cc (array of strings), bcc (array of strings), template_id (foreign key to templates.id), status (enum: draft, sent, failed), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.emailServiceProviderAPI: Integration with an external email service provider (e.g., SendGrid, AWS SES) for sending emails via API calls

function: Provides a user interface for composing email messages including subject, body, and metadata fields
static_description: Displays a form titled 'Compose Email' with a cornsilk background and peru-colored borders. Includes labeled input fields for Subject, To, CC, BCC, and Body. Has buttons for Attachments, Templates, Send, Save Draft, and Cancel. Uses placeholder text in each field.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Send' triggers validation checks and submits the composed email data to the backend API endpoint '/api/send-email'. Shows loading spinner during submission.
Clicking 'Save Draft' saves current composition to the database with status='draft' and displays confirmation message.
Clicking 'Cancel' prompts user to confirm discard action before clearing the form.

resource_dependency.contactDataSchema: Table 'contacts' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string, unique), phone (string), company (string), created_at (timestamp)

function: Enables users to select email recipients either from a searchable list of existing contacts or by manually entering email addresses
static_description: Within the email composer, shows a multi-select dropdown labeled 'To' with a search bar. Below it, displays a list of saved contacts in a scrollable pane with checkboxes next to each name/email pair. Manual entry textbox appears when typing unrecognized addresses.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the dropdown toggles visibility of the contact list panel.
Typing in the 'To' field filters displayed contacts dynamically and allows freeform email address input separated by commas.
Selecting a checkbox adds the corresponding email to the recipient list; unchecking removes it.

function: Allows users to attach files to outgoing emails before sending
static_description: Shows an 'Attachments' section within the compose form featuring a drag-and-drop zone styled with cornsilk background and dashed peru border. Displays attached files as removable tags below the drop area with filename and size information.

interaction_and_states.description: Dragging files over the drop zone highlights the area. Dropping uploads files asynchronously to the server and updates the UI with progress indicators per file.
Clicking the 'Browse Files' button opens native file picker dialog. Selected files begin uploading immediately upon selection.
Clicking the 'X' icon on any uploaded attachment tag removes that file from the email.

resource_dependency.emailStatusTrackingSchema: Table 'email_logs' with fields: id (UUID), email_id (foreign key to emails.id), recipient_email (string), delivery_status (enum: queued, delivered, bounced, opened), sent_at (timestamp), delivery_time (timestamp)

function: Provides an interface for users to view previously sent emails and monitor their delivery status
static_description: Presents a tabbed navigation with 'Sent Emails' selected by default. Displays a sortable table listing emails with columns: Date Sent, Recipient Count, Subject, Status Summary, Actions. Each row uses a beige tone (#FFF8DC) background with peru accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a table row expands it to show detailed recipient-specific delivery statuses fetched from backend logs.
Clicking column headers sorts the table ascending/descending based on that columnâ€™s value.
Clicking the refresh icon reloads the sent emails list from the backend without full page reload.

resource_dependency.templateStorageSchema: Table 'templates' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), subject_template (text), body_template (text), variables (JSON array), created_by (string), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Enables creation, storage, and reuse of predefined email templates
static_description: Features a modal dialog titled 'Email Templates' accessible from the compose screen. Contains tabs for 'My Templates' and 'Create New Template'. Lists existing templates in a grid layout showing name and preview snippet. Form includes Name, Subject Template, and Body Template fields with variable insertion helper.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a template card populates the active email composer with its subject and body content.
Clicking 'Save Template' stores the current form contents to the database after validating required fields.
Clicking the delete icon beside a template entry prompts confirmation then deletes it from the database.

resource_dependency.contactDataSchema: Table 'contacts' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string, unique), phone (string), company (string), created_at (timestamp)

function: Manages personal contact book allowing addition, modification, and removal of recipient entries
static_description: Accessible via dedicated 'Contacts' navigation link. Renders a responsive table of contacts with Name, Email, Phone, Company columns. Features inline editing controls and bulk selection checkboxes. Includes floating action button '+' for adding new contacts.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the '+' FAB opens a slide-in form panel pre-filled with empty fields for new contact entry.
Clicking the pencil icon in a row switches that row into editable mode with save/cancel options.
Clicking the trash bin icon deletes the associated contact record after prompting for confirmation.

resource_dependency.emailCompositionSchema: Accepts JSON payload containing subject, body, sender_email, recipients, cc, bcc, template_id, attachment_ids

function: Handles incoming email composition data from frontend and initiates processing workflow
static_description: RESTful POST endpoint accepting structured email data. Validates inputs against schema definitions and prepares data for downstream services like templating engine and email dispatcher.

resource_dependency.postgresConnectionConfig: Uses env vars DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp
resource_dependency.databaseInitializationScript: Creates tables: emails, contacts, templates, attachments, email_logs with appropriate constraints and indexes

function: Establishes secure connection between backend services and PostgreSQL database instance using provided credentials
static_description: Backend module responsible for initializing database connection pool at startup using environment-based configuration. Ensures all subsequent queries use this pooled connection.

resource_dependency.externalEmailServiceAPI: Third-party email delivery API such as SendGrid or AWS SES requiring authentication token and supporting batch send operations
resource_dependency.deliveryStatusWebhookURL: Publicly accessible URL endpoint configured to receive asynchronous delivery notifications from email provider

function: Dispatches formatted email messages through integrated third-party email service provider
static_description: Asynchronous service worker that receives processed email payloads and forwards them to external SMTP gateway or REST API endpoint. Handles error responses and retries according to provider guidelines.

resource_dependency.templateStorageSchema: Table 'templates' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), subject_template (text), body_template (text), variables (JSON array), created_by (string), created_at (timestamp), updated_at (timestamp)

function: Stores user-defined reusable email structures and retrieves them on demand
static_description: Persistent storage layer managing email template lifecycle including creation, retrieval, update, and deletion. Serves templates in normalized format ready for merging with runtime data.

resource_dependency.attachmentMetadataSchema: Table 'attachments' with fields: id (UUID), original_filename (string), stored_path (string), mime_type (string), size_bytes (integer), upload_timestamp (timestamp)
resource_dependency.fileStorageLocation: Local filesystem path or cloud storage bucket designated for temporary holding of uploaded files pending email dispatch

function: Receives binary file uploads from clients, persists them securely, and associates metadata with relevant email records
static_description: Secure HTTP handler accepting multipart/form-data requests carrying file streams. Stores files temporarily and returns identifiers used to reference attachments during email assembly phase.

resource_dependency.contactDataSchema: Table 'contacts' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string, unique), phone (string), company (string), created_at (timestamp)

function: Maintains centralized registry of known correspondents with full Create, Read, Update, Delete capabilities
static_description: Stateless API controllers exposing standard CRUD methods backed by persistent contact store. Enforces uniqueness constraint on email addresses and supports partial match searches across multiple fields.

resource_dependency.emailLogSchema: Table 'email_logs' with fields: id (UUID), email_id (foreign key to emails.id), recipient_email (string), delivery_status (enum: queued, delivered, bounced, opened), sent_at (timestamp), delivery_time (timestamp)
resource_dependency.statusUpdateMechanism: Polling mechanism or webhook listener capturing real-time feedback from email delivery infrastructure

function: Records historical events related to dispatched messages and tracks granular delivery outcomes per recipient
static_description: Background logging subsystem continuously monitors transmission pipelines and writes outcome metrics to durable datastore. Provides audit trail and enables analytics dashboards.

resource_dependency.installAllScriptCommand: "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\""
resource_dependency.projectRootDirectoryStructure: Root folder containing separate frontend/ and backend/ subdirectories alongside shared package.json

function: Defines unified installation procedure for setting up entire development environment spanning client-side and server-side components
static_description: Custom NPM script defined in root package.json designed to execute dependency resolution tasks simultaneously across frontend and backend codebases using concurrent execution utility.

resource_dependency.devStartScriptCommand: "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\""
resource_dependency.developmentServerPorts: Frontend typically runs on port 3000; backend usually listens on port 5000 unless otherwise configured

function: Launches coordinated local development servers for both frontend web application and backend API simultaneously
static_description: NPM command leveraging concurrency tooling to initiate hot-reloading development environments side-by-side ensuring seamless interaction testing between layers.
